__e: "And there was the soft steady hum of conversation among the wounded "who could not sleep.
Nearly 900 dead and wounded - - They were alone, suffering until the last vestige of life was frozen out of their bodies.
We will withdraw as soon as we have secured all those wounded who are well enough to be moved.
I'd take my wounded and go while you still can.
The rest of you, take care of the wounded and go on back to town.
Lieutenant, go get from the wounded and from the others anything you can.
Aren't you worried about having all your wounded in one place?
I want my wounded out of there and in the hospital in 15 minutes. I want my men out.
The sooner we get the wounded back on their feet, the sooner we shall win this war.
